page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY -BUTTERTON.
page.content: We went on a tour of the village with Mr Myatt.The village has 50 houses, 1O0 inhabitants, 10 children, 12 dogs and 9 cats. The oldest house is Millstone cottage; it used to be the rectory.In the village street there is the old school. The school and the cottage next door share the same dividing wall. The village green is rather long. It used to have the village hall on it. Opposite the school the "spout". No longer is the water drinkable. The village pond was empty, but the V.R.postbox was newly painted. We went through the gateway of old Butterton park, past Lodge Cottage,and Butterton House. We saw the ruins of Butterton Hall. We walked through a field of Barley and Thistle. The church wood had a trail of Bluebells.We saw the quarry with signs of sandstone and igneous rocks. Then back to the church
